title: Alex Mooney
added: On January 11, 2021, the Democrats introduced a resolution to call on Vice President Mike Pence to invoke the [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution]] to remove Trump in response to the attack on the Capitol. When the resolution was presented, Mooney objected to the adoption stating that Congress "should not adopt a resolution of this magnitude without any debate on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives. It is wrong to have sent members of Congress home and then try to adopt without any debate a precedent-setting resolution that could imperil our Republic."<ref>{{cite news |title=Mooney objects to Pelosi bid to invoke 25th Amendment on Trump by unanimous consent |url=https://www.wvnews.com/news/wvnews/mooney-objects-to-pelosi-bid-to-invoke-25th-amendment-on-trump-by-unanimous-consent/article_7ebe4e14-d619-582b-a66c-1cb12d0547af.html |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=WV News |date=11 January 2021 |language=en}}</ref>
